hanzi-su-wiki:
該

Значения

Вышеупомянутый, данный, этот; широкий (о знаниях)

Мнемоника

Словесный 言 запрет на секс 亥 для военных на захваченной территории. Упомянутый; то, что следует выполнять.

Варианты

该

heisig_chinese_memo: I asked my teacher what this strange word meant, and she furiously replied that I should read the above-stated paragraph before throwing an acorn at me!
heisig_constituent: above-stated, say, words, keitai, mouth, sign of the hog, acorn, top hat
koohiiStory1: I asked my teacher what this strange word meant, and she furiously replied that it was explained in the above-stated paragraph before throwing an acorn at me!
koohiiStory2: The above-stated words are the acorn from which the following statement grows.
jp_example_words: 該当(がいとう): corresponding, answering to, coming under
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You want to slice what you say in half so that people focus on the above text first. The above is what you want them to see! So slice what you say!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine actually slicing the words you say in the air. The above section is what you want people to pay attention to, so you slice a big gap between the above and the below words.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: As you focus on the above words you realize a guy (がい) is trying to push the rest of the things you're saying back up with the rest of them. No! The above text is all that matters! Go away guy!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: That guy doesn't care if the above is all he's supposed to hear. That guy sucks.
Ru_Notes: Сравни: 慨 (ガイ глубоко тронут), 概 (おおむね、ガイ в общих чертах)

gāi: (глаг/местоим) быть должным (деньги); этот, данный, вышеупомянутый (обычно в официальных документах)
gāi: (глаг) заслуживать, полагаться, следовать; используется в восклицательных предложениях в качестве усилителя
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the hog's (亥) words (言) are above-stated
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: This teacher throws acorns at the students when they are throwing words around talking. 'You should pay attention!'
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " words " and " hai ", it means that the military will abstain from the contract. "Shuowen": "Yeah in the army. Congyan, Haisheng. Reading if you are full of it."

" The " can mean having and sufficient. "Guanzi·Xiaowen": "The former emperor is neutral, the place is thousands of miles away, and the four-speaker should be the one." Yin Zhizhang's note: "Yes, prepare it. It is said that the four-speaking is enough to prepare a thousand miles."

" The " also means including. Cao Zhi of the Three Kingdoms "Book with Yang Dezu": "So my king set up a skynet to cover it, and now I learned that the country is here."

" The " also means extensive. "The Book of Jin-Zuti Biography": "Hou is the secretary of the Expo. It is time to cover the past and the present."

" The " often means that it should be so and should be. "Journey to the West" Chapter 21: "Tathagata took care of him, and he should not be guilty of death."

" The " is also used for management. Ming Yu Jideng "Allusions Jiwen" Volume 16: "This calendar year is long, there are no rat beetles, but after the crowd, there is no loss."

" The " also means equivalent or equivalent. Ming Ma Huan's "Yingya Shenglan-Java Kingdom": "The method of weighing a catty is twenty taels per catty, twenty-six dollars per catty, four aunts per catty, and the official scale is two cents 18 cents per cent. "

In modern Chinese, " the " is also used as a pronoun to refer to the person or thing that has been mentioned, such as "the person" and "the book". "The Scholars" Chapter 19: "For this reason, the card is up to the county, and the criminal will be taken."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " speaking " and " hai ", it means that the military bans.
humanum_full_description:
從「言」，「亥」聲，表示軍中戒約。《說文》：「軍中約也。从言，亥聲。讀若心中滿該。」

　　「該」可表示具備、充足。《管子‧小問》：「昔者天子中立，地方千里，四言者該焉。」尹知章注：「該，備也。謂四言足以備千里之化。」

　　「該」也表示包括。三國魏曹植〈與楊德祖書〉：「吾王於是設天網以該之，頓八紘以掩之，今悉集茲國矣。」

　　「該」還表示廣博。《晉書‧祖逖傳》：「後乃博覽書記，該涉古今。」

　　「該」常表示理應如此、應當。《西游記》第21回：「如來照見了他，不該死罪。」

　　「該」亦用作管理。明余繼登《典故紀聞》第16卷：「今歷年既久，不無鼠蠹，經該人眾，不無散失。」

　　「該」也表示折合、相當於。明馬歡《瀛涯勝覽‧爪哇國》：「斤秤之法，每斤二十兩，每兩十六錢，每錢四姑邦，該官秤二分一厘八毫七絲五忽。」

　　近現代漢語中，「該」也用作代詞，指稱已提及的人或事，如「該人」、「該書」等。《儒林外史》第19回：「為此，牌仰該縣，即將本犯拿獲。」
humanum_short_description: 從「言」，「亥」聲，表示軍中戒約。

該当(がいとう): corresponding, answering to, coming under

從「 言 」，「 亥 」聲，表示軍中戒約。《說文》：「軍中約也。从言，亥聲。讀若心中滿該。」 「 該 」可表示具備、充足。《管子‧小問》：「昔者天子中立，地方千里，四言者該焉。」尹知章注：「該，備也。謂四言足以備千里之化。」 「 該 」也表示包括。三國魏曹植〈與楊德祖書〉：「吾王於是設天網以該之，頓八紘以掩之，今悉集茲國矣。」 「 該 」還表示廣博。《晉書‧祖逖傳》：「後乃博覽書記，該涉古今。」 「 該 」常表示理應如此、應當。《西游記》第21回：「如來照見了他，不該死罪。」 「 該 」亦用作管理。明余繼登《典故紀聞》第16卷：「今歷年既久，不無鼠蠹，經該人眾，不無散失。」 「 該 」也表示折合、相當於。明馬歡《瀛涯勝覽‧爪哇國》：「斤秤之法，每斤二十兩，每兩十六錢，每錢四姑邦，該官秤二分一厘八毫七絲五忽。」 近現代漢語中，「 該 」也用作代詞，指稱已提及的人或事，如「該人」、「該書」等。《儒林外史》第19回：「為此，牌仰該縣，即將本犯拿獲。」
From the sound of " words" and " hai", it means that the military will abstain from the contract. "Shuowen": "Yeah in the army. Congyan, Haisheng. Reading if you are full of it." " The" can mean having and sufficient. "Guanzi·Xiaowen": "The former emperor is neutral, the place is thousands of miles away, and the four-speaker should be the one." Yin Zhizhang's note: "Yes, prepare it. It is said that the four-speaking is enough to prepare a thousand miles." " The" also means including. Cao Zhi of the Three Kingdoms "Book with Yang Dezu": "So my king set up a skynet to cover it, and now I learned that the country is here." " The" also means extensive. "The Book of Jin-Zuti Biography": "Hou is the secretary of the Expo. It is time to cover the past and the present." " The" often means that it should be so and should be. "Journey to the West" Chapter 21: "Tathagata took care of him, and he should not be guilty of death." " The" is also used for management. Ming Yu Jideng "Allusions Jiwen" Volume 16: "This calendar year is long, there are no rat beetles, but after the crowd, there is no loss." " The" also means equivalent or equivalent. Ming Ma Huan's "Yingya Shenglan-Java Kingdom": "The method of weighing a catty is twenty taels per catty, twenty-six dollars per catty, four aunts per catty, and the official scale is two cents 18 cents per cent. " In modern Chinese, " the" is also used as a pronoun to refer to the person or thing that has been mentioned, such as "the person" and "the book". "The Scholars" Chapter 19: "For this reason, the card is up to the county, and the criminal will be taken."

該字的基本解释

該
gāi
见“该”。

該字的汉语字典释义

[①]［gāi］
［《廣韻》古哀切，平咍，見。］
“该1”的繁体字。
(1)具备；充足。
(2)包容；包括。
(3)广博。
(4)宽大。参见“該放”、“該宥”。
(5)有；拥有。
(6)承受。
(7)命运注定。
(8)应当；理应如此。
(9)大概，估计情况应该如此。
(10)用于感叹句中以加强语气。
(11)相当于，折合。
(12)管理。
(13)约束。
(14)轮值，值班。
(15)轮到。
(16)欠。
(17)代词。指上文说过的人或事物（多用于公文）。
(18)方言。此；这。
(19)方言。关，相干。
(20)通“咳1”。参见“該該”。

該字的康熙字典解释

【酉集上】【言字部】　該； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页1158第16
【唐韻】古哀切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】柯開切，?音垓。【說文】軍中約也。　又【玉篇】盛也。　又【增韻】載也。【廣韻】備也，咸也，兼也，皆也。【穀梁傳·哀元年】此該之變而道之也。【註】該，備也。【前漢·律歷志】該藏萬物。【揚子·太?經】萬物該兼。　又【正字通】俗借爲該當之稱，猶言宜也。凡事應如此曰該。　又人名。【左傳·昭二十九年】少皡氏有四叔，一曰該。該爲蓐收。【註】金正也。　又姓，見【姓苑】。

暂无。

gāi

The
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［gāi］
["Guangyun" ancient mourning, ping 咍, see you. ]
"The 1" in traditional characters.
(1) Available; sufficient.
(2) Tolerant; include.
(3) Broad.
(4) Leniency. See "this place", "this you".
(5) Yes; own.
(6) Accept.
(7) Fate is doomed.
(8) Yes; it should be so.
(9) Probably, this is probably the case.
(10) Used in exclamatory sentences to strengthen the tone.
(11) Equivalent to, converted.
(12) Management.
(13) Constraints.
(14) Rotation, on duty.
(15) Turn.
(16) Owed.
(17) Pronouns. Refers to the people or things mentioned above (mostly used in official documents).
(18) Dialects. This; this.
(19) Dialects. Related, coherent.
(20) Pass "Cough 1". See "this".

[Guang Yun] Bei Ye, Xian Ye, Jian Ye, Ji Ye. [Guliang Chuan·The First Year of Ai] This should be changed. [Note] Yes, prepare it. [Previous Han·Lüzhi] All things in the collection. 【Yangtze·Tai?
